sub_title: expatlanguageconsulting.com/offer 👈 check out how I help the coolest small & medium language schools with our comprehensive marketing solutions that *actually* work
summary:
I do marketing, brand and business strategy for expat language schools so that they can scale their business and deliver their best services with ease.

How did I get here? For over 10 years I was working as a consultant for NGOs and social enterprises. I was getting assignments mainly for the European Union, different Polish ministries, city halls and governmental units.

In 2017 I have decided to leave everything behind and move to France, from where I jumped to the Netherlands and here to stay (Rotterdam! 🥰).  Before that I lived in Poland (clearly), Romania and Ireland.

During my years abroad I have noticed how big of a difference learning the local language makes. And how important it is to find a good school - one that will not only teach the language, but also take me through the difficult experience of assimilating into a new culture.

Today I help the language schools for expats to create that special, next level experience. All while ensuring the biggest growth they’ve ever experienced.

contributors.headline: expatlanguageconsulting.com/offer 👈 check out how I help the coolest small & medium language schools with our comprehensive marketing solutions that *actually* work

profile_positions.description:
We are the first-ever creative agency working exclusively with expat language schools. We help language schools to save time and increase sales by empowering them with thoughtful advice and hassle-free marketing.

We provide business, marketing, and brand strategy for expat language school owners so that they can level up their business with ease . We offer 1:1 consultations, commissions, and an online course.

We work exclusively with expat language school owners, providing tailor-made solutions exactly for that type of business. Our focus is so narrow that we can give an exceptionally detailed and precise potion to grow.
profile_positions.title: Business Owner

profile_positions.description:
“The new life abroad” was a project that was born to beat the expat blues I was feeling, fight the expat partner stereotypes, which are affecting mental health and wellbeing of thousands of people around the world.

This project was created also as my “playground” – a place, where I could practice new marketing & social media skills. It wass my creative outlet and the way for me to stay in touch with the newest marketing and social media trends.

Responsibilities:

👉 scripting, recording, animating and editing videos
👉 developing a website (using Squarespace)
👉 creating and publishing blog posts
👉 creating graphics and thumbnails for the blog and social media platforms
👉 managing social media platforms (YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest)
👉 creating and managing e-mail subscription base
👉 creating e-mail sequences, digital downloads
profile_positions.title: Content Creator

company.name: Erasmus+ | EU programme for education, training, youth and sport

profile_positions.company: Erasmus+ | EU programme for education, training, youth and sport
profile_positions.description:
I am an international trainer with over 500 hours of experience. I am able to create projects - from the idea, through the planning and programming project, funds finding up to implementation and evaluation phase. My specialty is creating an amazing group experience, that leaves people, even after a short workshop, feeling like they have been friends forever. I specialize in informal education.

Responsibilities:

👉 creating project drafts and applying for funds (including budgeting, planning the activities, writing out the phases of preparation and implementation)
👉 managing the projects (mainly financial and program parts)
👉 conducting and facilitating the activities
👉 marketing the projects (incl. dissemination activities)
👉 evaluating the projects and creating the summaries
profile_positions.title: Trainer

company.name: AAAMI - Association pour l’accompagnement des actions de mobilité internationale

profile_positions.company: AAAMI - Association pour l’accompagnement des actions de mobilité internationale
profile_positions.description:
I was brought in by the CEO in order to help her to organize the work of the entire organization, increase its visibility and, as a result, expand the fundraising possibilities.

I have created a development (growth) strategy, which included media and communication plan, financial and fundraising strategy, project management, and long-term planning. I have introduced online business and productivity tools to both daily work, project management and long-term planning. As a result of my work my CEO was able to bring two additional employees after my project was finished and found their salaries with external funds.

Responsibilities:

👉 creating a development (growth) strategy, which included media and communication plan, financial and fundraising strategy, project management, and long-term planning
👉 introducing online business and productivity tools to both daily work, project management and long-term planning
👉 giving interviews to media and speeches to young people potentially interested in taking part in Erasmus+ activities
👉 organizing a series of workshops which aimed to develop and support the language skills of young people preparing to travel abroad as volunteers
profile_positions.title: European Voluntary Service

profile_positions.description:
I have an experence of ove 7000 training hours.

Clients:
The Institute of Urban Development, Regional Center of Social Policy, Association Integration and Development (SIR), Mazovian Center of Social Economy, Caritas Centre of St. Jacek in Katowice, The Civil Affairs Institute (INSPRO)

Examples of training topics: local partnerships; social economy (basic course); sustainable development; partner acquisition and networking; how to cope with a difficult client; fundraising and budgeting basis; cooperation with business; planning and implementation of projects; potentials, needs and resources (mapping); team management (including work in a virtual environment using online tools); strategic planning and management (including strategy for financing non-governmental organization projects, project management); Public Relations for NGOs; events - planning and implementation (including green events principles), evaluation.
profile_positions.title: Trainer

profile_positions.description:
I have written hundreds of publications, both online and in traditional media, converting e-mail campaigns.

Depending on the needs of the client I was: preparing advertisements and promotional texts for social media; ghost writing on an expert blog; creating articles and expert publications on a variety of topics; preparing media publications (both creating as well as editing); preparing newsletters, website articles.

Clients: KIWIportal, Telma Group Communications, Easy Times (Heroes), The City of Lodz Office, Mazovian Center of Social Economy.
profile_positions.title: Copywriting experience (polish)

profile_positions.description:
My tasks, depending on the role and client, were one of the below:
👉 organizational support for planned events and event managing (including preparing offers, program and budgets, coordinating logistics, customer care, business negotiations, preparing tenders, working closely with the accounting departments, managing the project documentation).
👉 creating and implementing social media strategies
👉 creating branding guidelines and following through with them
👉 in some instances – coordinating the works of PR companies, in others – working for the PR companies

My main achievements:
Preparing and co-managing over 20 big scale corporate events, co-organizing nearly 50 events of various scales, managing a circus for a week, winning the tender for the first polish “5 portions a day” campaign. Managing six profiles on Facebook (business, culture and social related).

Clients: Business Target Group, Lodz of Four Cultures Festival, Gambit Sp. z o.o., Star Events, Health Think Public Relations.
profile_positions.title: Experience in the field of public relations, social media, marketing and event managing

profile_positions.description:
The aim of the “Model city revitalization” project (which was my main placement) was to create the core advisory body for the cities, that were preparing to start their own revitalization processes in the upcoming year (using EU funds). 

I was chosen to become one of the few experts in their fields, who were giving workshops, speeches and were helping to create strategic plans and documents for the cities of all sizes. I have written multiple renewal strategies (mainly socio-economic parts), conducted 10 intense, day-long workshops in 5 different cities around Poland and a series of individual, local workshops/ partnership meetings. I have helped to draft or evaluate dozens of local revitalization plans, took part in both partnership and expert meetings on the matters connected to urban renewal. I was my organization’s representative in the key partnerships in Warsaw.
profile_positions.title: Expert on social and economic aspects of revitalization

company.name: The City of Lodz Office, Revitalization and Development of the City of Łódź Office

profile_positions.description:
The department of revitalization (especially the sub-department of economic and social affairs) was created in order to prepare both the city hall and the city residents to all the changes that were supposed to happen with the planned revitalization. The 4 members of the socio-economic department were responsible for planning all the social and economic changes that were needed in order to revive the city, as well as ensure, that the whole process will not have damaging effects on the local businesses and the social tissue of renovated areas.

During the whole project I was responsible for social media platforms, website (CMS), managing the PR company and media plan implementation. On behalf of the City Hall I was, together with my colleagues, carrying out social consultations on the city's revitalization plan. I was supervising the process of creating publications (leaflets, newspapers, and books) about local revitalization activities. I was managing the writers, editors, graphic designers, publishing houses etc. I was writing and conducting tenders, preparing financial and methodological reports for local and EU sponsors. My main achievement though was creating an operational and financial plan of a local social rehabilitation centre for people endangered with social exclusion and homelessness.
profile_positions.title: Department of Economic and Social Affairs staff member

profile_positions.description:
The main aim of the project was to empower the social economy enterprises (NGO’s, small socially responsible companies) by giving them tools to economic independence, guide them, help them creating strategies, teach them how to communicate their actions. I was not only responsible for giving consultations, but also for creating local partnerships between NGO’s, businesses, local authorities and representatives of the education sector.

My contribution, achievements and results:
Creating over 30 intersectoral partnerships and initiatives. Over 2000 counselling hours on topics related to PR, marketing, fundraising, creating strategies and business plans.
profile_positions.title: Coordinator of the Regional Centre of Social Entrepreneurship and local partnerships coordinator
